result.execSummary:
The defendant Brendan G. Kelley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 1 day, if revoked.
Early termination can be requested by DOC if deemed appropriate.
Expungment consideration for misd offenses only.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Batter's Treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*    Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Early termination can be requested by DOC if appropiate.  Expunement consideration for misd offenses only.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Hartley.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 1 is dismissed and read in. Court amends bond to $1,000 cash, with conditions *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/ Kaylon F or either directly or indirectly her residence.  *House arrest after 8pm at night.  SEH set for 7/15/16 at 8:45am.

Judge Wayne Marik, Acting Br. 6 today only.  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Hartley.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Hartley states he met w/deft and believes the case may be resolved, would like case set for PLEAS.  ADA Phan believes a PSI will be requested at time of plea.  PLEAH set for 5/10/16 at 9am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
With Atty Hartley the time of the FPT on 4/20/16 is changed from 8:45pm to 3pm, due to a conflict w/the court's calendar.
